content.description: Climb up the left side stemming. Then climb up some nice holds. It's slightly overhanging. An easy 10d.
content.location:
To the left of

Back to Zero

.

content.description: Follow three bolts on Back to Zero, then up and right for four more bolts.
content.protection: 7 bolts to chains (fitted with clipping biners)

content.description:
Lots of good sized cobbles to choose from on this steady moderate route.

A top rope can be set up by hiking to the top via the slope to the right. Use bolts on top to do a short rappel to the chains.
content.location: Starts between two bushes on the right side of the wall.

content.description: One of the worst routes I have ever climbed anywhere.  Very Very Very Dirty. Uninspiring in every way. The FA likely didn't post it due to embarrassment.  May clean up with more traffic....maybe.
content.location: Starts directly out of the bushes right of the 10.a climb at Anti-Gravity wall.

climbs.name: Calm Before The Storm
climbs.fa: Bolted by Thomas Holmes & Tyson Taylor, FA Guy McAtee

content.description: Four bolts of climbing makes up the moderate yet pumpy start, it takes more out of you than you'll think. Mid route offers a pretty comfortable rest that allows you to collect yourself before committing to the steep section of climbing. Two bolts make up the steep section, the higher you go the harder it gets, all leading up to the final crux move guarding the chains.
content.protection: 6 lead bolts with a 2 bolt chain anchor.
content.location: If you are standing at the base of the route "Back To Zero" this route is behind you on the far end of the wall, not visible from the other routes. Roughly 15 feet up the talus. Look for a pair of dangling chains atop a short steep section of rock.

content.description: This is one of the best 11c in maple. It has amazing movement with good holds and underclings then the climb changes personality for the last crux - it's blank with sequential pockets and tricky feet. Well protected if you fall here - I've taken many falls at this part! Have fun.
